name: Tu Youyou
quote: Every scientist dreams of doing something that can help the world.
summary: Chinese pharmaceutical chemist and malariologist who discovered artemisinin, a groundbreaking malaria treatment, and won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.
shortDescription: Tu Youyou is a Chinese pharmaceutical chemist and malariologist who discovered artemisinin, a groundbreaking malaria treatment. Her work has saved millions of lives and earned her the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Ningbo, China, Tu Youyou studied pharmacology at Peking University Medical School. She was inspired by traditional Chinese medicine and modern science.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Tu led Project 523, a secret military project to find new malaria treatments. She discovered artemisinin from sweet wormwood, revolutionizing malaria therapy.
detailed_description.challenges: Tu worked during the Cultural Revolution, with limited resources and recognition. She persevered through scientific and political obstacles.
detailed_description.achievements: Discovered artemisinin, saving millions of lives, and became the first Chinese woman to win a Nobel Prize in science.
detailed_description.legacy: Her discovery is the foundation of modern malaria treatment and global health efforts.
